553b4687-919c-5a91-9a82-26a2eac6fd40.title: the width of trench at and below the level of the top of the pipe shall be such that the horizontal clearance from the outside of the pipe to the wall of the trench is greater than >300mm, less than <600mmm.

6719dba9-5593-5f45-8747-02da21791df3.title: Clearance from external faces of the pit to each face of the excavation to be not less than 400mm

09a67fe4-9ce0-5550-a7b6-ef2bf910482b.title: distance between culvert wall and trench wall is between 0.5 - 1.0 x the overall height of the culvert.

cb3dd0fd-58bd-5963-a42d-e39a5c43bfbf.title: Reference Documents: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.16 Cl. 701.20(a)

d0caa90e-3c16-5738-9554-ef133bcad4e3.title: Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm loose thickness.

d05103c9-b179-59bb-97e9-5a894cd4073d.title: Acceptance Criteria: Bedding material shall be provided and placed for the full width of the trench. The compacted thickness of bedding material following any shaping necessary shall be:

839a9208-fa39-588d-b73a-89fba32c701f.title: Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.

60b27f1f-4465-5c4f-93da-880e2d68c8f5.title: minimum 200mm for pipes with D ≥ 1500 mm

75043f6d-09d8-5630-96fe-6ae14cdf969d.title: D' is the nominal pipe diameter or culvert width.

d399b511-b621-5b7c-8df9-174d24e152c8.title: Once culvert sections are in position, an additional layer of bedding material is placed to a height equal to 30% of the nominal pipe diameter or culvert height.

33c6d6d5-dead-5c21-b56b-50982e2350f0.title: Where applicable, the top of the pipe as marked shall be within five degrees of the vertical axis of the culvert.

389ec531-3eb3-5dd9-a98c-ac8d76b2836a.title: Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

f088e249-5079-50db-8062-744906c6dbcb.title: Spacing of multiple rows of culverts to reflect Table 701.171.

0fd75248-50ac-5b18-b2af-ca332ab89633.title: The lower portion of the pipe shall be in contact with the bedding for the full length of each section. The compacted bedding shall be shaped to accommodate the joint collar and ensure that the pipe is supported along its full length.

276018de-dcf0-5a1f-8542-eef1ac60be1f.title: Acceptance Criteria: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

fbe83036-fe94-5ef2-933e-a0627a9eac53.title: Contact areas between the top and bottom sections mortared.

36a392ec-1a00-57ca-b678-e75fc3733908.title: Consecutive sections of box culverts are firmly placed butted together. The top section matched to the bottom section and no lips over adjoining bottom sections.

26c5e96e-fce1-51ea-bc10-193cd1bca180.title: Multi‑row box culverts laid with sections in each row in contact with the sections in the adjacent rows.

cd62a631-e6a9-5f20-ba7b-5a2ff86fafe0.title: Any exposed reinforcement shall be coated with an approved epoxy treatment to prevent corrosion.
